concept.title: Configuring IP settings for network interfaces
concept.shortdesc: You can configure IP settings for Ethernet interfaces either by using the or by using the edit ethernet-interface and ip commands on the command line. You can configure IP settings for aggregate interfaces by using the edit aggregate-interface and ip commands on the command line.

conbody.p:
When you configure the IP address and default gateway of a network interface, you can specify the following components:
IPv4 address The IPv4 address specifies an IP address, or range, in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) format. For example, 192.0.2.0/24. See Classless Inter-Domain Routing.
IPv4 default gateway The IPv4 default gateway specifies the IP address, or range, of the default gateway. You can enter an IPv4 default gateway only if you specified an IPv4 address.
IPv6 address The IPv6 address specifies an IP address, or range, in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) format. For example, 2001:0DB8::/32. See Classless Inter-Domain Routing.
IPv6 default gateway The IPv6 default gateway specifies the IP address, or range, of the default gateway. You can enter an IPv6 default gateway only if you specified an IPv6 address.

p.note: If you are deploying on a SoftLayer virtual server or on Amazon EC2, the Ethernet interfaces are pre-configured. The option to configure Ethernet interfaces is not available.
